article.headline: Lafayette 77, Holy Cross 70
article.story: WORCESTER, Mass. -- Ryan Willen scored 19 points and Lafayette never trailed on the way to a 77-70 victory over Holy Cross in the Patriot League tournament quarterfinals Wednesday night. The Leopards (12-18), the sixth seed, took advantage of 14 Holy Cross turnovers for 21 points and built their biggest lead, 10 points, midway through the first half. Holy Cross, the third seed, pulled to within 33-28 at halftime. Lafayette also got double-figure scoring contributions from Jim Mower (13 points), Jared Mintz (12), Levi Giese and Tony Johnson (10 apiece) to maintain the lead in the second half. It helped the Leopards offset Andrew Keister's 18-point, 15-rebound effort for Holy Cross (8-21), which outscored the Leopards 46-30 in the paint. The Crusaders struggled from outside, making only 2 of 16 from 3-point range. Lafayette advances to a Sunday semifinal against American University.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
